title: I love Mordekaiser but I hate playing him
body:
I adore his design.
A heavy Metal Overlord of Conquest clad in an iron shell.
His theme as an unrelenting force of malevolence, coming for you and there bing nothing you can do to stop him.
His voice, a strange sense of superiority and contempt lingering in it.

But by god do I hate playing him in his current state.
I hate being bullied out of lane due to my shitty base stats
I hate me not having ANY fallback pattern when I'm getting trashed, no way of playing safe, no way of simply farming for my late game
I hate basically handicapping myself if i want to roll solo
I hate how no matter how proficient I am in playing him there are champions that get rewarded way easier with way less effort.


//rant//

If you see other reworked juggernauts (Garen, Darius, Skarner) they all have a small gap closer or a spell who catches people. Mordekaiser just sits in the back, being useless and getting kited.

All I want for him is to have damage in solo lanes, have a better W because it's completely useless at solo lanes, have somekind of slow on any of his abilities, have MORE damage on his Q because the previous x1/x3/x9 combo was ALOT BETTER than x3/x3/x6, and have alot better base stats because his base HP and HP per level is crap (and also his armor p/lvl).

Well its about time that I throw my input in on another Morde thread. 

M.M.     knows me as I occasionally float around these parts. I have played Pre-DoomedWork Morde, I was with any other Morde main making his case for them to stop the rework. I've been through it all and let me say this. 

They. Done. Screwed. Up.

This has to be the saddest moment I have seen for the iron man and before pitchforks arrive, hear me out.


Morde was, in my opinion, in a solid spot before this rework ever happened. Everything in his kit  worked gloriously around his passive which is what made me want to play him. This was a champion who's passive, unlike a lot of champions, wasn't a simply buff but a tool. In the hands of a good Morde, you always had some kind of shield, otherwise not so much. That is what so interesting, The range of value you got from him was based on your experience alone. Even if you were in an unfavorable match up, say {{champion:103}}. She has always been annoying for Morde to deal with. Plenty of tools to deal with him. There was still plenty you could do even if you can't harass her. Throw your W around your self when your about to take a ball, Q a minion and get shield from each one it echoed to allowed you to stay in the game instead of being thrown out by all these long range champs.

Well look at him now.

His passive, what i considered the most influential part of his kit was trashed. His shield gain is pitiful early game compared to what it once was,  a necessary tool that made Morde what he was, and then they stick him bottom lane where your guaranteed a long range opponent that will undoubtedly poke you. I always had doubts with the rework and his current state unfortunately proved them to be correct, he simply doesn't feel fun to play as and hurts me to play as knowing him from pre-rework  and to see how low they have dragged him down. Anytime you time to E the carry you will just get kited down. Their range just is longer than the E ever could be and even if you do hit it, you will either lose the trade due to the health cost or come out barley even. 

The 3x 3x 6x Q now did nothing but hurt Morde. They put a ridiculous amount of Mordes power on the Q during the rework and though they hated the idea of the {{summoner:4}} third Q, but what did they expect us to do? No sane person would willingly let us hit them with the third Q and it was our only true way to output his damage without help. You see, the key to the problem, once again, in my opinion, is the bot lane switch. Its purpose was clear as to make Morde a more team oriented champion and threw this reliance on your support to be able to contribute to the game. The side affect is that you lack significance until such on opportunity a rises. Of course  it wasn't like this before, after the rework he was a god and would roll over any adc but that just showed how bad of a spot adc's were in at the time and how wonky Mordes numbers were. If they actually wanted Morde to be a bot lane menace they would have made his Q like the old one except when it would echo out, it would bounce around like a {{champion:9}}  E and then his E would have another 300 range! Sounds ridiculous right? Well unfortunately these are the sort of things they would have to do to his current catastrophe of a kit to make him an actual bottom laner. Better base stats will help don't get me wrong but its the kit that is the ultimate problem. They tried something for Morde which failed horrendously but still want to make viable solo lane and keep the bot lane idea going for what ever selfish reasons they have. The result is that they don't make a move in either direction, not back to the old Morde or something crazy for bottom lane Morde but eliminating solo lane Mordes viability and so were stuck watching them fiddle around with numbers praying it might work out.

As a result a feel as though he will be out for the count for a while until Riot makes a bold move on him. With this Shakespearean tragedy I have stopped playing League and have playing some Pikmin 2 again. Ah those good days when the solo player experience actually mattered. Rest assured, I haven't given up. I'm just waiting until the time is right for Morde to rise again.

In the mean time I look forward to Yooka-Laylee from PlayTonic games,  hope some Banjo- Kazooie fans are still out there.

Okay, im really curious. As what do you see Mordekaiser? Whenever i come to Mordekaiser threads, i get the impression that his fanbase like him because of his "Heavy Metal" (like in music theme instead of his armor) theme. Do you seem him more as such instead of a Undead Warlord like Overlord, Sauron or the Lich King?

This might sound slight offensive, but i actually do care about Mordekaiser and never actually saw him as the "Heavy Metal (Music)" Knight. More like a Fallen Knight with a giant mace. There is almost always the word  "Heavy Metal" in a Mordekaiser thread, which lefts me kinda alienated because im not into it at all. It's really strange, so i thought i might contribute to the conversation.

To begin with, Mordekaiser is flawed, which is no secret. His kit and gameplay identitiy are a gigantic mess which reminds me of the old Sion. This is the first thing that has to be visualized before oneself, before talking about possible solution. Mordekaiser can only be improved and fixed if parts of him gets **sacrificed** and replaced with better and new elements. He can't be improved if he doesn't sacrifice some parts of him that makes him what he is. Just like Poppy, Trundle, Sion and more did. They had a dedicated fanbase but they got changed somewhat drastically from their former self, for the better!

Riot actually talked about making mordekaiser from AP to ad once, long ago, before obviously dumping that idea. I initially expected that they work on making Mordekaiser AD and finding a way to make him work that way. Think about it, he is a giant guy, with a giant mace, why doesn't he deal any physical damage outside of his basic attacks? It would open him up to new abilities and ways how to improve and fix his dilemma. Being AP restricts him, from the items he can use and the balancing that is possible. Why not allow him to be reinvented to an hard hitting AD Juggernaut? Perhaps then, he can finally secure his place in the Top Lane. Yes i know, AP Mordekaiser Mid was fun, but didn't make much sense either, it was either extreme feast or famine. The Iron Revenant will only be restored if his fanbase allows him to **change** ! Because change is what he needs, how can Riot fix him if his fanbase doesn't allow him to change and be open about new things? Don't get me wrong here, the dedication you and the other Mordekaiser mains have for him is very **VERY** admirable. Even getting his title to change and giving feedback and possible solutions on a regular basis.

AP Mordekaiser should die and be reborn as a AD Juggernaut with old improved and new abilities that truly suits the Iron Revenant.
Change passion for the old Mordekaiser to full commitment to improve and re-enhance the ancient Warlord. Let him experience the **Phoenix Effect** , so that he might find his true identitiy and place in the League of Legends!

One last thing, i think the Juggernaut update on Mordekaiser is a big fail expect for his Q, so i dont want him to get butchered, i really think this is a necessary step, otherwise Riot will be too scared or hesitate to change mordekaiser. Do we really want Mordekaiser to become the **second Skarner** ? No, you guys obviously deserve better, but have to change aswell instead of desperately trying to preserve all of Mordekaiser abilities and making them "slightly" better.

This is what i think about this whole situation.

I'm up for changes, the thing is these changes weren't for the better and instead finished ruining the champion. He was given a nuke in exchange of every single tool in order to allow him to apply it himself, therefore, forcing him into a duo lane. Again, I'm up for changes but the thing is when your champion gets totally changed to serve another role outside yours then being up for changes is just irrelevant from that moment on. That is why I'm personally angry at them. For taking the champion from me and serving him to another different playerbase that only use him for the cheap stuff, but now that he's been "balanced" and all the artificial advantage shits the designers implemented on him are gone then nobody plays him for real. No mains, no Freelo Express riders alike, no one.

I played mostly main top lane Mordekaiser, and he was pretty damn good up there, granted, in the right hands.

I like Ranged Morde more than this version and if it were for me I would gladly sacrifice his Mace for the identity back.

You have very valid points, but the very reason we are pissed is because this rework was a total failure and alienated us from the champion we love. So these changes made us angry, and the "Change" mentality is irrelevant to us Morde players because these changes just took the champion away from us.

I remember saying the first time he hit pbe for the "rework" they should've just went all-in on an AD rework instead of this hybrid shitstorm we got. He would be able to ACTUALLY itemize well if he had better AD scalings and did physical damage since Black Cleaver would've been a blessing to him if he did physical damage (since as AP he gets jack for CDR out of items) and items like Titanic Hydra/Mallet/Steraks/etc would be much better items to pick up than they already are. The new Death's Dance would also be better on him than Gunblade if he did physical damage since it gives defensive stats as well as the vamp (since he can shield AND vamp through the bleed). Idk I just feel him being AP still is just riot not wanting to change him THAT much, but instead gimp him for it still. I mean they had no problem FORCING Poppy and Sion into AD builds when they were both easily played both ways pre-reworks (poppy didn't do THAT good AP after removal of DFG but it wasn't complete garbage).

One final thought. Why does Morde still not pay out of shield for his health costs if they are going to keep them at such an absurd number compared to every other health user WHO ALL HAVE SUSTAIN BUILT INTO KIT. Like I would at least like to somewhat "heal" the costs by avoiding them somewhat if I land an E first or something because it doesn't matter if I sit at full shield all laning phase if I'm at 3/4 by using E for harass.

Brutal, heavy, powerful, with themes commonly found in the genre. Also quite literal heavy and metal XD

I'd gladly see him reworked fully BUT I think being the only AP Juggernaut is what makes him unique.
Also, he's less like Darius who slices you but his strength comes from necromantic energies and unholy magic infusing his armor and Nightfall, his cursed touch and mastery over the fabrics of Death make his strikes so devastating.

Actually, he doesn't. I mained Top Mordekaiser with mostly Ghost/Teleport and I feel confident in saying you really don't need Ignite. If you are using your Lv1 Ult for the DoT damage then you are using it wrong. At Lv1, it should be used as an Execute, meaning that you really need to make the proper calculations in order to kill with the initial burst or as I call it, "The Cardiac Arrest inducing spell", not the DoT. Unless you are just marking them before finishing them off with Q as now it is the main damage source. But if you are indeed looking to finish them off with ult then what I just mentioned applies.

Of course, this is something that comes with experience but once you get there you will know when to execute them and get sneaky kills with it by second nature, without ever relying on Ignite. Ignite is definitely great on him, can't deny the fact, but for Top, in my case is really not that necessary. Mid Morde is another thing of course but Teleport was always a favorite for me due to the constant pressure you can apply with it and valuable your utility is when it comes to global contesting.
